question_text: Select two valid statements about how routers and layer 3 switches handle forwarding decisions:
answer_options: Both devices use the destination IP address to select the outbound interface
Routers forward traffic at layer 2 using MAC addresses only
Layer 3 switches combine routing and switching in one device
Routers always require manual configuration for every subnet
Layer 3 switches do not support routing protocols
correct_answer: Both devices use the destination IP address to select the outbound interface
Layer 3 switches combine routing and switching in one device
explanation: Routers and layer 3 switches both route based on IP addresses, but layer 3 switches also provide high-speed hardware switching.
